html: Paul quotes this passage to the Corinthians and says that when the resurrection takes place, this saying will be brought to pass (see 1 Cor. 15:54). The wiping away of the tears refers to the effects of the Atonement; this metaphor is used twice by John (see Rev. 7:17; 21:4). The "rebuke of his people" represents the continual trials and afflictions which the Savior will cause to cease among Israel. Thus this verse is clearly a messianic prophecy, or a testimony of what Christ will do for the world, and especially for Israel.
